what: Download Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data — get_ces
title: Download Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data — get_ces
text: function downloads Current Employment Statistics data Bureau Labor Statistics. data includes national, regional, state, substate employment statistics. default, available areas, data types, periods included.

title: Download Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data — get_ces
code: get_ces(   transform = TRUE,   monthly_only = TRUE,   simplify_table = TRUE,   suppress_warnings = FALSE,   return_diagnostics = FALSE )

title: Download Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data — get_ces
text: transform Logical. TRUE (default), converts employment values thousands actual counts multiplying 1000 specific data types (codes 1, 6, 26) removes ", Thousands" data type labels. monthly_only Logical. TRUE (default), filters annual data (period M13). simplify_table Logical. TRUE (default), removes excess columns creates date column Year Period original data. suppress_warnings Logical. FALSE (default), prints warnings BLS download issues. TRUE, warnings suppressed still returned invisibly. return_diagnostics Logical. FALSE (default), returns data. TRUE, returns full bls_data_collection object diagnostics.

title: Download Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data — get_ces
text: default, returns data.table CES data. return_diagnostics = TRUE,   returns bls_data_collection object containing data comprehensive diagnostics.

title: Download Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data — get_ces
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download CES data (streamlined approach) ces_data <- get_ces()  # Download with full diagnostics if needed ces_result <- get_ces(return_diagnostics = TRUE) ces_data <- get_bls_data(ces_result)  # Check for download issues if (has_bls_issues(ces_result)) {   print_bls_warnings(ces_result) } } # }

what: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
title: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
text: function downloads Job Openings Labor Turnover data U.S. Bureau Labor Statistics. JOLTS data provides insights job market dynamics including job openings, hires, separations, quits, layoffs. Data available national, regional, state levels various industry size class breakdowns.

title: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
code: get_jolts(   monthly_only = TRUE,   remove_regions = TRUE,   remove_national = TRUE,   suppress_warnings = FALSE,   return_diagnostics = FALSE )

title: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
text: monthly_only Logical. TRUE (default), excludes annual data (period M13) includes monthly observations. remove_regions Logical. TRUE (default), excludes regional aggregates (Midwest, Northeast, South, West) identified state codes MW, NE, , . remove_national Logical. TRUE (default), excludes national-level data (state code 00). Set FALSE include national data industry size class breakdowns. suppress_warnings Logical. TRUE, suppress individual download warnings cleaner output batch processing. return_diagnostics Logical. TRUE, returns bls_data_collection object full diagnostics. FALSE (default), returns just data table.

title: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
text: default, returns data.table JOLTS data. return_diagnostics = TRUE,   returns bls_data_collection object containing JOLTS data following key columns: series_id BLS series identifier year Year observation period Time period (M01-M12 months) value JOLTS statistic value (transformed based data type) date Date observation state_text State name dataelement_text Type JOLTS measure (job openings, hires, separations, etc.) area_text Geographic area description sizeclass_text Establishment size class industry_text Industry classification ratelevel_code Whether value "Level" (count) "Rate" (percentage) periodname Month name

title: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
text: function performs several data transformations: Converts rate values proportions (divides 100) except Unemployed Job Opening ratio. Converts level values actual counts (multiplies 1000) Creates proper date column year period Adds readable month names

title: Download Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) Data — get_jolts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download state-level JOLTS data (default - returns data directly) jolts_data <- get_jolts()  # Include national data with industry breakdowns jolts_national <- get_jolts(remove_national = FALSE)  # Get full diagnostic object if needed jolts_with_diagnostics <- get_jolts(return_diagnostics = TRUE) print_bls_warnings(jolts_with_diagnostics)  # View job openings by state for latest period job_openings <- jolts_data[dataelement_text == "Job openings" &                            date == max(date)] } # }

what: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
title: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
text: function downloads Local Area Unemployment Statistics data U.S. Bureau  Labor Statistics. Due large size LAUS datasets (county city  files >300MB), users must specify geographic level download. function  provides access seasonally adjusted unadjusted data various geographic levels.  Additional datasets provide comprehensive non-seasonally-adjusted data areas broken  5-year increments

title: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
code: get_laus(   geography = "state_adjusted",   monthly_only = TRUE,   transform = TRUE,   suppress_warnings = FALSE,   return_diagnostics = FALSE )

title: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
text: geography Character string specifying geographic level adjustment type. Default "state_adjusted". Valid options : "state_current_adjusted" - Current seasonally adjusted state data "state_unadjusted" - historical unadjusted state data "state_adjusted" - historical seasonally adjusted state data (default) "region_unadjusted" - Unadjusted regional division data "region_adjusted" - Seasonally adjusted regional division data "metro" - Metropolitan statistical area data "division" - Division-level data "micro" - Micropolitan statistical area data "combined" - Combined statistical area data "county" - County-level data (large file >300MB) "city" - City town data (large file >300MB) "1990-1994" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 1990-1994 "1995-1999" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 1995-1999 "2000-2004" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 2000-2004 "2005-2009" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 2005-2009 "2010-2014" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 2010-2014 "2015-2019" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 2015-2019 "2020-2024" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 2020-2024 "2025-2029" - Comprehensive unadjusted data 2025-2029 "ST" - state two-character USPS abbreviation, plus DC PR monthly_only Logical. TRUE (default), excludes annual data (period M13) creates date column year period. transform Logical. TRUE (default), converts rate ratio measures percentages proportions dividing 100. Unemployment rates expressed decimals (e.g., 0.05 5% unemployment) rather whole numbers (e.g. 5). suppress_warnings Logical. TRUE, suppress individual download warnings cleaner output batch processing. return_diagnostics Logical. TRUE, returns bls_data_collection object full diagnostics. FALSE (default), returns just data table.

title: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
text: default, returns data.table LAUS data. return_diagnostics = TRUE,   returns bls_data_collection object containing LAUS data following key columns: series_id BLS series identifier year Year observation period Time period (M01-M12 months, M13 annual) value Employment statistic value (transformed transform = TRUE) date Date observation (monthly_only = TRUE) area_text Geographic area name area_type_code Code indicating area type measure_text Type measure (unemployment rate, labor force, employment, etc.) seasonal Seasonal adjustment status

title: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
text: function joins data multiple BLS files: Main data file (varies geography selection) Series definitions (la.series) Area codes names (la.area) Measure definitions (la.measure)

title: Download Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS) Data — get_laus
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download state-level seasonally adjusted data (default operation) laus_states <- get_laus()  # Download unadjusted state data laus_states_raw <- get_laus("state_unadjusted")  # Download metro area data with rates as whole number percentages (64.3 instead of 0.643) laus_metro <- get_laus("metro", transform = FALSE)  # Get full diagnostic object if needed laus_with_diagnostics <- get_laus(return_diagnostics = TRUE) print_bls_warnings(laus_with_diagnostics)  # Warning: Large files - county and city data # laus_counties <- get_laus("county") # laus_cities <- get_laus("city")  # View unemployment rates by state for latest period unemployment <- laus_states[grepl("rate", measure_text) & date == max(date)] } # }

what: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
text: function downloads processes national Current Employment Statistics (CES) data Bureau Labor Statistics (BLS). retrieves multiple related datasets joins together create comprehensive employment statistics dataset industry classifications, data types, time period information.

title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
code: get_national_ces(   monthly_only = TRUE,   simplify_table = TRUE,   show_warnings = TRUE,   return_diagnostics = FALSE )

title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
text: monthly_only Logical. TRUE (default), excludes annual averages (period "M13") returns monthly data. FALSE, includes periods including annual averages. simplify_table Logical. TRUE (default), removes several metadata columns (series_title, begin_year, begin_period, end_year, end_period, naics_code, publishing_status, display_level, selectable, sort_sequence) adds formatted date column. FALSE, returns full dataset available columns. show_warnings Logical. TRUE (default), displays download warnings diagnostics. FALSE, suppresses warning output. return_diagnostics Logical. TRUE, returns bls_data_collection object full diagnostics. FALSE (default), returns just data table.

title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
text: default, returns data.table CES data. return_diagnostics = TRUE,   returns bls_data_collection object containing data comprehensive diagnostics.

title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
text: function downloads following BLS CES datasets: ce.data.0.AllCESSeries - Main employment data ce.series - Series metadata ce.industry - Industry classifications ce.datatype - Data type definitions ce.period - Time period definitions ce.supersector - Supersector classifications datasets joined together provide context labels employment statistics. function uses `fread_bls()` helper function download read BLS data files robust error handling diagnostic reporting.

title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
text: function requires following packages: dplyr, data.table, httr, lubridate (date formatting simplify_table=TRUE). `fread_bls()` `create_bls_object()` helper functions must available environment.

title: Get National Current Employment Statistics (CES) Data from BLS — get_national_ces
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get monthly CES data with simplified table structure ces_monthly <- get_national_ces()  # Get all data including annual averages with full metadata ces_full <- get_national_ces(monthly_only = FALSE, simplify_table = FALSE)  # Get monthly data but keep all metadata columns ces_detailed <- get_national_ces(monthly_only = TRUE, simplify_table = FALSE)  # Access the data component ces_data <- get_bls_data(ces_monthly)  # Get full diagnostic object if needed data_with_diagnostics <- get_national_ces(return_diagnostics = TRUE) print_bls_warnings(data_with_diagnostics) } # }

title: Generic BLS Dataset Download — load_bls_dataset
text: function generalizes method download BLS data given time series database. files accessed https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/ several datasets available. summary identified database can generated using `bls_overiew()` function. multiple potential data files exist (common large data sets), function prompt input file use.

title: Generic BLS Dataset Download — load_bls_dataset
code: load_bls_dataset(   database_code,   return_full = FALSE,   simplify_table = TRUE,   suppress_warnings = FALSE )

title: Generic BLS Dataset Download — load_bls_dataset
text: database_code two digit character identifier desired database. Valid options : "ce" - National Current Employment Statistics Data "sm" - State Metro area Current Employment Statistics Data "mp" - Major Sector Total Factor Productivity "ci" - Employment Cost Index "eb" - Employee Benefits Survey return_full argument defaults FALSE. set TRUE return list elements data retrieved BLS separating data, series, mapping values downloaded. simplify_table parameter defaults TRUE. TRUE remove columns date "_code" column name, well series internal identifiers provide general information series needed performing time series analysis. parameter also converts column "value" numeric generates date column year period columns data. suppress_warnings Logical. TRUE, suppress individual download warnings processing.

title: Generic BLS Dataset Download — load_bls_dataset
text: function return either bls_data_collection object (return_full FALSE provided)  named list returned data including bls_data_collection object.

title: Generic BLS Dataset Download — load_bls_dataset
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download Employer Cost Index Data cost_index <- load_bls_dataset("ci")  # Download separated data, series, and mapping columns benefits <- load_bls_dataset("eb", return_full = TRUE)  # Download data without removing excess columns and value conversions productivity <- load_bls_dataset("mp", simplify_table = FALSE)  # Check for download issues if (has_bls_issues(cost_index)) {   print_bls_warnings(cost_index, detailed = TRUE) } } # }
